abstract: New York City Council unanimously votes to pass Freelance Isn't Free Act, which gives freelance workers protection against wage theft and requires employers to agree in writing to timetable and payment procedure; measure is believed to be first of its kind in country.
lead_paragraph: The City Council passed the Freelance Isn’t Free Act, requiring written timetables and procedures for payment to clamp down on wage theft by employers.
snippet: The City Council passed the Freelance Isn’t Free Act, requiring written timetables and procedures for payment to clamp down on wage theft by employers....

headline.main: As Freelancers’ Ranks Grow, New York Moves to See They Get What They’re Due
headline.print_headline: City Council Moves to Help Freelancers Collect on Pay
